meanings.definition: The act of thinking about or planning something before doing it.
meanings.sent1: Her premeditation before the test helped her perform well.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's premeditation was evident in his detailed plan.
meanings.sent3: His premeditation to bring an umbrella on a sunny day made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The premeditation of the chess player was like a carefully crafted strategy.
meanings.sent5: The premeditation of the chef in preparing the dish made it taste exquisite.

meanings.sent1: The jury considered the defendant's premeditation in the crime.
meanings.sent2: The premeditation of the decision was clear in his calm demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The premeditation of the cat before pouncing on the toy was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The premeditation of the storm was evident in the dark clouds gathering.
meanings.sent5: The premeditation of the flower blooming in the spring was a beautiful sight.
